## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about the Verus DeFi testnet and I'm curious to learn more. Is the Verus DeFi testnet a centralized network?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it's not! The Verus DeFi testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network. It has 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, and is available worldwide, running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. So, it's a decentralized platform where the community plays a vital role in maintaining the network.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. I've also been wondering, do the currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have real value?

**AI Assistant:**
No, they don't. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. The testnet is meant for testing and experimentation, so the assets and currencies there are purely for testing purposes and don't hold any real-world value.

**User:**
Good to know. I've also heard concerns about 51% hash attacks. Is the consensus algorithm used on the Verus testnet vulnerable to 51% hash attacks?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it's not! The consensus algorithm used on the Verus testnet is 51% hash-attack resistant. So, you don't have to worry about the security of the network being compromised by such attacks. The Verus team has taken steps to ensure the testnet is secure and reliable, and the algorithm in use is designed to prevent such attacks.
Is the Verus DeFi testnet a centralized network?

No, the Verus DeFi testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network. It has 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, and is available worldwide, running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet.

## The New Verus DeFi Testnet
This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever announced, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf- **DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm** - This is a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. We will list it here and describe it below. Using it is simple. Understanding the implications of what such a protocol can do when rent free and integrated in a truly decentralized public blockchain is a process of realizations that is likely to be similar to layers of an onion. We will do our best to explain below.
Do the currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have real value?
No, all currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet.
